Package edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_scheduler.course

Class Event

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_scheduler.course.Activity
      • edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_scheduler.course.Event
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Conflict
    public class Event
extends Activity
    Creates an event object which can be added onto the WolfScheduler's schedule. Contains fields such as event details, title, meeting days, and start/end time. Methods include getters and setters for fields, and overrides isDupliate and get display array to accustom the Event class. Event is a subclass of Activity.
    Author:
    michaelabrams

    • Constructor Detail

      • Event

        public Event​(java.lang.String title,
             java.lang.String meetingDays,
             int startTime,
             int endTime,
             java.lang.String eventDetails)
        Creates an Event object given an event title, meeting days, start and end time, and event details.
        Parameters:
        title - is the title for the Event.
        meetingDays - are the meetingDays for the event.
        startTime - is the start time for the event.
        endTime - is the end time for the event.
        eventDetails - is the event details for the event.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if eventDetails parameter is null, title is null or empty, meetingDays is null or empty, or start/end time has invalid times for a standard 24 hour day.

      • setEventDetails

        public void setEventDetails​(java.lang.String eventDetails)
        Sets the Event's eventDetails. If eventDetails is null, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        eventDetails - is the eventDetails to set
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if eventDetails parameter is invalid

      • getShortDisplayArray

        public java.lang.String[] getShortDisplayArray()
        Returns a short display array of an event object. Implemented as a required method of the abstract Activities class. Example Output: ["", "", Lunch, W 5:00PM-7:00PM]
        Specified by:
        getShortDisplayArray in class Activity
        Returns:
        a short display array of an event object.

      • getLongDisplayArray

        public java.lang.String[] getLongDisplayArray()
        Returns a long display array of an event object. Implemented as a required method of the abstract Activities class. Example Output: ["", "", Lunch, "", "", W 5:00PM-7:00PM, Lunch with the boys, ""]
        Specified by:
        getLongDisplayArray in class Activity
        Returns:
        a long display array of an event object.

      • setMeetingDaysAndTime

        public void setMeetingDaysAndTime​(java.lang.String meetingDays,
                                  int startTime,
                                  int endTime)
        Sets meeting days and time. Throws IllegalArgumentException if meeting days is null/empty, contains invalid characters or start/end time is out of bounds. Overrides setMeetingDaysAndTime in Activity class to check specific invalid characters for Event objects.
        Overrides:
        setMeetingDaysAndTime in class Activity
        Parameters:
        meetingDays - is the meetingDays to set for an event object
        startTime - is the startTime to set for an event object
        endTime - is the endTime to set for an event object
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if meetingDays, startTime, or endTime are/is invalid.

      • meetingDaysHasInvalidCharacters

        public boolean meetingDaysHasInvalidCharacters​(java.lang.String meetingDays)
        Parses meeting days for invalid characters
        Parameters:
        meetingDays - is the meetingDays which need to be checked
        Returns:
        true if meetingDays has invalid characters and false if no invalid characters are found.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Creates a string representation of an event object using title, meeting days, and start/end time fields.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a string representation of an event object.

      • isDuplicate

        public boolean isDuplicate​(Activity activity)
        Checks to see if an activity is a duplicate of an event object. An event and activity are duplicate if they are both events and share the same title. Implemented as a required method of the abstract Activities class.
        Specified by:
        isDuplicate in class Activity
        Parameters:
        activity - is the activity checked for as a duplicate
        Returns:
        true if the activity is a duplicate event, otherwise returns false
